intro: Antheroporum glaucum, commonly known as the blue antheroporum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, blue-green leaves that are covered in a fine, waxy coating. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It is native to parts of Asia and thrives in moist, temperate environments. Antheroporum glaucum is often found in meadows and along stream banks, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its habitat.
